author: Art Nickler

review: The setup.Let me start by saying that I've ordered literally ALMOST everything through amazon in terms of technology, household items, accessories, etc and I've never been let down in terms of delivery and customer service.I received my Chromecast two days after ordering it which was expected as I am a Prime Member of Amazon. It came in perfect condition, packed neatly with no problems or rips or dents on the box itself.The connection too the television was smooth and simple and quite quickly as all I had to do was connect the Chromecast to an HDMI output on my Vizio LED and then connect the USB into the chromecast from the USB port on the TV itself. There were no problems and it instantly turned on as soon as I turned the TV on.The first problem however came up during the setup. Chromecast WOULD NOT connect with my phone and in turn connect itself too the WiFi which of course was frustrating but I wasn't the only one. I have a Samsung Galaxy S5 so compatibility wasn't an issue but I just kept having issues until I decided to put my phone on top of the Chromecast to see if it worked, and after 10 minutes of trying? WAH LA!I use an application called Local Cast which allows me to stream directly from my Galaxy (I use Showbox) so I can watch movies and shows and also listen too music.I definitely recommend this buy too anyone as it will work with Apple Products and Android as well!!! Bummer Apple is so ignorant and blind that they won't allow Android products to use their Apple TV when it's also really well built and extremely stable but at a steep price. These 35.00 are well worth more than the 100.00 Apple is selling their Apple TV for.
